DOC.brief_summary: Prospective , multi-center , bilateral , double-masked , randomize , cross-over , daily wear , 1 month dispense study ( 2 week lens pair )
DOC.brief_title: Performance Comparison Between Fanfilcon A Senofilcon C Sphere Lenses
DOC.detailed_description: The aim study determine clinical performance fanfilcon A comparison senofilcon C sphere contact lens .
DOC.criteria: A person eligible inclusion study he/she : Is 18 40 year age ( inclusive ) Has read , understood sign information consent letter Has selfreported eye exam last two year Is spherical soft contact lens wearer Has contact lens prescription fit within available parameter study lenses Has spectacle cylinder great 0.75D ( Diopters ) eye Can achieve best correct spectacle distance visual acuity 20/25 ( 0.10 logMAR ) good eye Can achieve distance visual acuity 20/30 ( 0.18 logMAR ) good eye study contact lenses Has clear cornea active ocular disease Is willing anticipated able comply wear schedule ( 8 hour per day ; 5 day week lens wear ) Is willing able follow instruction maintain appointment schedule A person exclude study he/she : Has history achieve comfortable CL ( Contact Lens ) wear ( defined 5 day per week ; > 8 hours/day ) Is currently wear senofilcon C ( 2 week lens ) , senofilcon A 1Day , senofilcon C ( monthly lens ) enfilcon A contact lenses Is habitually use rewetting/ lubricate eye drop per day Presents clinically significant anterior segment abnormality Presents ocular systemic disease need medication might interfere contact lens wear Presents slit lamp finding would contraindicate contact lens wear : Pathological dry eye associate finding Significant pterygium , pinguecula , corneal scar within visual axis Neovascularization > 0.75 mm limbus Giant papillary conjunctivitis ( GCP ) bad grade 1 Anterior uveitis iritis ( history past year ) Seborrheic eczema eyelid region , Seborrheic conjunctivitis History corneal ulcer fungal infection Poor personal hygiene Has know history corneal hypoesthesia ( reduced corneal sensitivity ) Has aphakia , keratoconus highly irregular cornea Has presbyopia dependence spectacle near work contact lenses Has undergone corneal refractive surgery
